item.title: Black Friday Week : le OnePlus 13R, avec sa batterie digne d’un marathonien, perd 250 €
item.description: Plus abordable que le OnePlus 13, le OnePlus 13R présente tout de même une fiche technique solide sur quasiment tous les aspects. Pour le découvrir, son constructeur le fait passer de 769 euros à 519 euros.

item.description: My 2 top Kindle devices - the Amazon Kindle Colorsoft and Kindle Scribe (2024) - get a Black Friday discount that drops them to the lowest prices I've seen.

item.title: Wyze’s new security camera watches your yard from inside your home
item.description: Wyze has announced an unorthodox approach to outdoor security cameras with its new Window Cam that monitors your yard and property from inside your home. This Rear Window approach to security means the camera doesn’t need batteries, Wi-Fi range extenders, access to an exterior power outlet, or weatherproofing. The company already offers window mounts for […]...

item.title: Test du Dreame V20 Pro-A : un peu d’ombre à Dyson
item.description: On a l'habitude de payer 800 euros pour avoir le privilège d'un aspirateur balai haut de gamme. Dreame arrive, pose son V20 Pro à peine au-dessus des 300 euros, et se permet d'ajouter des options que les leaders n'ont même pas, comme un bras robotisé pour les plinthes. Sur le papier, c'est l'affaire du siècle. En réalité, est-ce que ça vaut vraiment le coup de lâcher les grandes marques comme Dyson ? On va voir ça. ...

item.title: Grab an 8TB SSD for 4.8¢ per Gigabyte, an all-time low, in an extraordinary price bloodbath ahead of Black Friday
item.description: The Crucial X10 offers plenty of storage and has a sleek, modern design and it is at its lowest price ever this Black Friday.

item.title: L’un des plus grands télescopes de l’histoire pourrait finalement être construit… à deux pas de chez nous, en Europe !
item.description: Le projet du Thirty Meter Telescope (TMT), un télescope terrestre de 30 mètres de diamètre, envisagé initialement sur le Mauna Kea à Hawaï, pourrait désormais voir le jour sur l'île de La Palma en Espagne. Cette décision s'expliquerait par un manque de soutien financier de la National Science...

item.title: Does AI have a role to play in mental health treament?
item.description: Ellie Pavlick, director of a new institute dedicated to exploring AI and mental health, and Soraya Darabi of VC firm TMV, an early investor in mental health AI startups, discuss whether AI can help with mental health treatments—and what guardrails are necessary. In recent weeks, OpenAI has faced seven lawsuits alleging that ChatGPT contributed to suicides or mental health breakdowns. In a recent conversation at the Innovation@Brown Showcase, Brown University’s Ellie Pavlick, director of a new institute dedicated to exploring AI and mental health, and Soraya Darabi of VC firm TMV, an early inve...

item.title: Cheese recall hits grocery stores nationwide right before Thanksgiving
item.description: Ambriola Company has recalled select Pecorino Romano SKUs sold across the U.S. Consumers are urged to inspect their packages immediately. Just days before Thanksgiving, as Americans shop at supermarkets nationwide for their holiday meals, Ambriola Company, which makes some Boar’s Head products, has issued a recall for select pecorino romano cheese products due to possible contamination from listeria. ...

item.title: Boeing’s troubled Starliner won’t carry astronauts on its next mission
item.description: The capsule had so many problems that NASA ordered it to come back empty, leaving the astronauts stuck there for more than nine months. Boeing and NASA have agreed to keep astronauts off the company’s next Starliner flight and instead perform a trial run with cargo to prove its safety.

item.title: How to rebalance your portfolio in a soaring market
item.description: If you’ve chosen a target asset allocation—the mix of stocks, bonds, and cash in your portfolio— you’re probably ahead of many investors. But unless you’re investing in a set-and-forget investment option like a target-date fund, your portfolio’s asset mix will shift as the market fluctuates. In a bull market you might get more equity exposure […] If you’ve chosen a target asset allocation—the mix of stocks, bonds, and cash in your portfolio— you’re probably ahead of many investors. But unless you’re investing in a set-and-forget investment option like a target-date fund, your portfolio’s asset...

item.title: Nurses are rallying to defend their profession after nursing degrees were deemed not ‘professional’
item.description: “To go from ‘healthcare hero’ to not being recognized as a professional is such a back-handed slap,” one registered nurse told ‘Fast Company.’ The Trump administration left nursing off a list of “professional” degrees in a move that could directly limit how future nurses will finance their education.

item.title: AI now writes more than half of new online articles. What’s next for human authorship?
item.description: AI appears to be most useful when the writing in question is low-stakes and formulaic. The line between human and machine authorship is blurring, particularly as it’s become increasingly difficult to tell whether something was written by a person or AI.

item.description: Following on from Pennywise's return, actor James Remar speaks about his character's obsession with Pennywise and his difficult behavior.

item.title: Your AI use policy is solving the wrong problem
item.description: To fix it, you need a mindset shift. When a company with tens of thousands of software engineers found that uptake of a new AI-powered tool was lagging well below 50%, they wanted to know why. It turned out that the problem wasn’t the technology itself. What was holding the company back was a mindset that saw AI use as akin to cheating. Those who used the tool were perceived as less skilled than their colleagues, even when their work output was identical. Not surprisingly, most of the engineers chose not to risk their reputations and carried on working in the traditional way....

item.title: Zootopia 2 review: Subversive Disney sequel tackles discriminatory urban planning. Yes, really!
item.description: "Zootopia 2" feels as fun and familiar as "Zootopia," but what sets it apart is how it examines prejudice in city planning.
